title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very disorganized with no clear description of the position. Interviewer wasn’t prepared at all. I felt like it was a waste of my time for an IT position. The interviewer was just trying to get someone in the open position.
Interview Questions: How do you interact with difficult IT management?

title: Integration Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and easy, people were super nice. Interviewed with consultant company, various levels of focus. Then drilled down to interviews with future peers, which became more detailed and technical in nature.
Interview Questions: Direct experience and examples from past implementations

title: Medical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Wadsworth, OH) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: In person, and over the phone and texting. Great conversation including lots of information . Answered all of my questions about the position. Showed me around the entire office. Introduced me to a couple of employees that were there.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for Full Time or PRN?

title: Data Analyst Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: It began with a very short and brief phone screening with an HR representative that gave me a rundown of what the job title is and if it was what I was interested in. Following this I had an interview with the manager of the enterprise data analytics as well as the director that oversees the team. It was quick but very straight forward with minimal knowledge-based questions.
Interview Questions: How good of a multitasker are you? How well do you handle pressure?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, quick response. Manager was down to earth and friendly. Very thorough reviewing my resume. Gave me a great detailed description of the company and the unit. Gave me a tour of the department
Interview Questions: How long have you practiced in the clinical area?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Submit application on line. Got an email for an Interview after about 3 days. Got a scheduled interview after 2 days. Interview went great. She was very nice. Told me a lot about the hospital/ unit. Only asked a few questions.
Interview Questions: What would your co workers and supervisors say about you, if I were to ask them?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line, asked to take medical terminology  test and then asked to take typing test.  Asked me for interview.  Was offered job at the interview.  Interview was about 1 hour long and pleasant.
Interview Questions: Can you work weekends?  Can you work holidays?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: This was a Quick and simple interview process, a few nursing questions but mostly just told me about the position. The interviewer was friendly and polite as well as professional.
Interview Questions: They asked how I would respond in patient care  scenerios

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very easy typical questions. What’s your availability, what’s your expected salary. One of the questions was do you have a problem lifting because some of the patients are very heavy.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in transportation before

title: Patient Care Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great , very straight forward. It took about two months to hear back but I was in school. My friend also worked there and raved about me.
Interview Questions: Why did you want this job

title: Temperature Screener Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was so impressed with the interview that he told me that I was hired at the interview. He told me I’d hear back about orientation and a drug/background check within a week and instructed me to reach out to the HR coordinator if I hadn’t heard back. Well, a week went by so I reached out and she told me I should be hearing back very soon as they were finalizing other hires. It’s been a month and I haven’t heard anything so I moved on. Too bad, I hope they don’t do this to others.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit for this position?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for a 30 minute interview after filling out an application online.  The interview was with two managers.  I had worked at Summa in the past.
Interview Questions: What testing do you have experience with?

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Tell us about a time when type questions. What do you expect from co-workers?  Why do you want this job? What are you strong in? What would boss say about you?
Interview Questions: How do you handle an angry physician?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Average interview, behavioural questions. not very technical. Interview was laid back, took over a week to get the outcome. It was a positive experience, stick to basics and it wont be stressful
Interview Questions: General questions

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the company website, and then they called me and asked several questions about my patient care experience. They will ask you about your background and then a bunch of behavioral based interview questions.
Interview Questions: They asked questions wanting to know if I have ever worked with patients who have diabetic ulcers, wound vacs, NG tubes, etc. They also wanted to know if I was okay driving to patients homes.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very good, comfortable and unwind. The place is convenient and accessible. The hiring resource manager was nice and not tough. The atmosphere of the interview was okay and no pressure. Recommended!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the online application, the company then Emailed me, then I called them back and then I was asked many questions and then asked in the email after the phone conversation to fill another application out which was very redundant.
Interview Questions: What do you plan on doing with your degree after obtaining your BSN?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (New York, NY) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short interviews. Medical assistant jobs are pretty much the same across the board. Not much to go over other than your personal experience. Long waits in between interviews and follow up phone calls.
Interview Questions: what does your typical work day look like

title: Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: A phone screening with a recruiter, and then it moved on to a group meeting with the team. After that I received an offer within the next few days, and then there was negotiations on salary and start date.
Interview Questions: Previous experience, why Summa, and background with excel

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Medina, OH) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: You apply online for all positions. Someone from HR calls you to set up an appointment with the hiring manager. You usually only have one interview and then get a call from Hr if they want to offer you the job, or an email saying they went in another direction.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have for this job?

title: Vascular Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Contacted internally by HR, telephone conversation for interview time and date. met with RN Manager and held the interview within the Angiography department, asked typical interview questions for an internal applicant
Interview Questions: Who is the customer?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview with leaders, second with potential subordinates. In the end, the potential subordinates made the hiring decision, rather than the leadership. I found this surprising and contrary to what I had read our expected.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Summa Health System in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great. They were really approachable. I was very afraid since its my first time but they made me feel really good about myself. In the process they also incalculate certain values that they want for me as an employee to have.
Interview Questions: How can you be a benefit in this company?

title: Manager, Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Summa Health System (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience. They seem to want to listen to my answers and allowed me time to answer the questions. I was impressed that they brought someone in to interview me from Vegas, Neveda
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied on indeed. Received phone call within 3 hours. Interview very casual and calm. Common questions asked - how do you handle a stressful situation, ethical situation, strengths, etc. Peer interview scheduled and date has not arrived.
Interview Questions: How have you handled an ethical situation?

title: Medical Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very fake, not professional at all.  Met at a restaurant and practice manager ate her salad during the whole process.  Found out later she had told and promised 2 other Co workers the same.  Also included that she did not see herself sticking around much longer.
Interview Questions: How will you feel if you are not chose for this job?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview, two interviews in person with five individuals. Very friendly, overall pleasant experience, very encouraging Long wait between callbacks. Did not receive offer and no feedback given despite requests.  Feedback would be helpful and courteous but Summa appears to be unwilling to do this.
Interview Questions: Tell about yourself, give examples of difficulty and how you handled it, how did it end?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sat in office and conducted interview, asked lots of questions.  And asked about commute. Dress nice, use common sense and always be on your game.  Make sure to bring a copy of your resume. That always is a plus.
Interview Questions: why are you leaving your current job?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Summa Health System (New York, NY) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: short and sweet, got right to the point, gave a lot of details Sarah was very nice to meet and speak with, Talk about long term goals and how you would help improve the company
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Answeri Service Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received email thanking for my interest, will review, then contact you if you meet our qualifications. Three days later, I received another email stating my application had been sent to the interview team. It was about a week and a half later they called me for an interview. My interview was scheduled for a week later. I had only one interview. It's has been over a week now, and haven't anything back yet. The office building was beautiful and emaculat, only two years old,  and all the employees looked very happy.
Interview Questions: The entire interview was based on one statement...Tell me about yourself.

title: Utilization Review Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: You will interview with two managers at the same time then come back for a group interview with the team. The team will ask you varios questions related to your previous job experiences but they are a pretty laid back group. If you know your stuff be easy, relax, and you'll do fine.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: The people were very welcoming and nice. The place was nice and the people were nice. Good food, place was clean, smiling faces everywhere. Offered lunch and a tour. Lots of great options for food on site.
Interview Questions: Why Summa?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process.  The process is not integrated on that the individual who offers the job is unable to give pay rate or benefits package.  You must deal with another department for that information.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, there is a thorough application process where you can submit your resume and then after that wait to be called from the nurse recruiter. You will interview with her and then she will ask you your preference for where you would like to work in case there are other openings available (could be applying for a certain floor or for any openings). After that if they would like to further your interview process you will be called back for a second interview if they want and have you interview with the nurse manager. This was not a drawn out process. They were quick about getting back to me.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Call Cebter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Miami, FL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Nothing really hard, it was very laid back. Basic standard questions, just keep calm and you should get the job. Take your time when answering the questions, and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: BHT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Takes one month to get through whole process and start working the first day.  You meet the supervisor and interview with them them on to Human Resources. Then Human Resources will call you.
Interview Questions: Are you compassionate towards all races of people

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer never sat still during the interview, did not have interviewing skills, didn't ask the right questions.  Interviewer (CIO) was busy filling out reports when she interviewed me, threw a book and a butterfly pin at me and asked me to sign papers that she performed orientation training, which she did not-she presented a booklet  (first grade) on safety and patient safety-I read through it and signed it off.  Then I took a test online AFTER being hired in on hospital and patient safety.  That was on-boarding?  I was given an office without any supplies, without a laptop or computer-only a phone.  This remained this way for three weeks before I was given adequate supplies and a computer to begin my work.  Horrible work place for non-clinical workers.
Interview Questions: There were none.  That was the problem, it was vague and lacked direction.

title: ICU Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application and was called by HR to come in for an interview. After interview with HR manager, I interviewed with the Unit manager the same day. She said she had a few other applicants to interview but would let me know by the next week if I had got the job. I was offered the job the next week.
Interview Questions: Did not have any unexpected questions. Typical interview questions.

title: CDI DRG Clinical Documentation Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Dealing with HR was a nightmare. First off the communication wasn't up to par. VMs & a lot of uncertainty and condescending remarks about compensation. Did get to schedule an interview because Maria stated that they are looking for internal candidates which isn't true still have job posted.
Interview Questions: HR asking about pay before even scheduling an interview very unprofessional to me.CDI's based on experience, education, and ACA being in affect. there is certain pay you have to give to whom ever is in the position. I'm single with no kids or husband I do not get tax breaks.

title: Coordinator, GME Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH)
Interview Descriptions: First meeting with two directors, next meeting was group interview with several doctors and managers. HR was supposed to walk me to interview. Had to wait in HR reception area. HR manager showed up 20 minutes late, which the interviewers clearly thought it was me that was late.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected. Very straight forward interview.

title: Clinical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview and hiring process was very lengthy.  I interviewed with HR, then with the manager of the area, then with the Physician in charge of the area, then with the staff I would be working with.  4 separate interviews - 4 - 35 mile commutes
Interview Questions: Do you mind being on call?

title: Medical Billers/Certified Coders Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Uniontown, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Newspaper advertisement announced a "Career Fair" and indicated that positions for 1st and 2nd shift was available for medical billing, certified coders. When I arrived, there were signs giving directions into the building and people were readily available to answer questions and give instructions as to what floor/room preemployment testing was given in, as well as sign up sheets for the interview process. Over all everything was well organized and went very smoothly. The newspaper advertisement simply listed what they were looking for. As a Certified Coding Associate CCA I was unsure from the advert.as to whether or not they needed coders so I thought I would give the interview a try. The interviewer was honest and very helpful in explaning what the positions entailed, willingness to train, as well as discussing the general job market for billing and coding.
Interview Questions: In your past work experience, what would you consider to be the most difficult situation that you had to deal with, and how did you feel about it?

title: Registed Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was professional and complete.  I appreciate all the hard work the HR department does.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected or difficult questions.

title: Environmental Aide I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (North Akron, OH) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long process in my opinion. First you are called by a representative at HR that does an initial screen for all new candidates for every position. (Which by the way was strange because while in the waiting room I got nervous that everyone else looked super professional for an interview for a cleaning position. Made me feel a lot better when I realized they were there for other positions.) You go in, he/she asks basic questions that you really already answered on the application. You are set up for an interview with the manager for the position you applied. I attended that which was very unorganized. Seemed like the forgot they had an interview scheduled. Afterwards I waited for a call. Didn't want to take the initiative to call back for at least 2 weeks. When I finally did the manager claimed she was waiting on me to call her back. I think she really just forgot..again. She scheduled a day for me to go back to HR to get my uniform, badge and take a drug test. After that I had to call her back to schedule my first day. Came in a few days later and got trained by someone who seemed very surprised to be trusted with the job of training me.
Interview Questions: What are your hobbies, what are you in school for, why didn't you go to school for your hobby (art), how long do you plan to stay with us?

title: Research Billing Compliance Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Took on the role before offered position, no formal interview was required.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Summa Health System
Interview Descriptions: Formal, and technical. The second interview onwards was easier.
Interview Questions: What's your strategy to balance all your roles?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Posted to an online opening, and reached out to former colleague who recently transitioned over to the company. I received a phone interview, then an interview with HR. After that I interviewed with the top people in the department.
Interview Questions: Was more concerned with fit into the company than technical skills

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Several questions are asked to describe yourself, why you are the best candidate for the position.  Create work assignment to show your creative ability. Different questions are asked on how you would handle certain situations.
Interview Questions: What do you have to offer in the position.

title: RN, Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Go to Summa hospital and interview with the nurse manager on the unit, also do paperwork for human resources. Also background check and references. overall a very positive experience but can get nervous with 1;1.
Interview Questions: typical nurse questions;; what would you do if this happens or tell us something positive you did and something negative and how you handled the situation.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Cuyahoga Falls, OH) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I do not remember much of this experience but I only remember having one interview. I did communicate with the human resource manager several times on the phone since I was not the usual person applying for the position. Most interviews in my lifetime, questions have been why do your want to work here and what do you think the characteristics need to be of you and others in this environment. Part of my process I was given a handout book of the HIPPA laws and of the OBRA laws. I also have to submit to a TB test (it was over a span of two weeks since it was a 2-step). Since I volunteered at a hospital, everything had it owns place so the ability to go and in out of the building can be quite simple. The office where the interview took place was in a little hallway near the front entrance. The process also included learning how wheelchairs work so I interacted with another employee.
Interview Questions: I was not asked any difficult questions since the very basic of the process was very simple.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty basic. The same questions off a print off, nothing too intense. Lasted less than 30 minutes and was one on one. It took them weeks to make their decision and a month to make an offer.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview with an HR rep. Once she approved, I was scheduled with the manager of the unit. After that, I was contacted to have a physical, drug test (nicotine included), signed form for background check and then waited for them to contact me. Once the screening came back and was fine, I was called by the HR rep about an offer (specific shift, every other holiday and weekend, hourly rate, etc.) and the schedule of orientation dates.
Interview Questions: If we asked your former co-workers to describe you, what would they say?

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Summa leadership team was very prompt and professional.  Initial interviews were held over the phone with directors and physicians.  Questions were concise, yet not repetitive.  The questions differed greatly between directors (focus on operations and financials) and physicians (staff management and scheduling), which is typical.
Interview Questions: Please describe to me what you understand about ACOs?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Summa Health System (Akron, OH) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was given the name of a supervisor and there were two subsequent telephone conversations and then one interview with HR, when interviewed by HR the one staff member the interview was set up with was terminated and I had to wait when I arrived for my interview for a staff member to be come available to take the time to interview me for the requested position.
Interview Questions: The interview lasted approximately 5 minutes and consisted of questions regarding availability and past expierence
